title: Non-Reciprocal Transport of Thermally-Generated Magnons
authors:
M. Cosset-Ch\'eneau, S.H. Tirion, X.Y. Wei, J. Ben Youssef and B.J.
  van Wees
abstract:
We demonstrate the non-reciprocity of electrically and thermally-generated
incoherent magnon transport using the magnetization direction of a Py wire
placed on top of an ultrathin YIG film. We show that the transport properties
of thermally-generated magnons under a Py wire depends on the relative
orientation between the temperature gradient and the Py-magnetization
direction. The symmetries of this non-reciprocal magnon transport match with
those predicted by the remote dipolar interaction between YIG and Py magnons,
controlled by the chirality of the YIG magnon dipolar stray fields. We also
show that the directional magnon generation by the spin Seebeck effect from the
Py wire displays the symmetries expected from the chiral spin Seebeck effect.
